reviews.review:
Clunky and unresponsive. No clear feedback or indication whether or not the buttons you're pressing are actually doing anything. No real game settings or options, and no option to exit the game until after you make it past the "intro" area. Subtitles take up half the screen. Examining items by clicking and dragging with the LMB is chaotic at best, but mostly feels broken for trying to actually discern anything useful from examining something. English localization is abysmal: While the game claims to have full English audio, count on the conversations being exclusively in subtitles with no spoken audio. The game recommends headphones for a superior experience, but the stereo effects make no directional sense.

I have only regrets.

This game... sucks. It was like an even worse story than the "B-Rated" horror movies from the 80's. "Cooking" isn't even really relevant to the story at all. It makes you wonder why the entire cooking part in the start is even a part of the game. The atmosphere is nice... they did a good job building the house... but they should've built a story on top of that too. Keep your money when it comes to this game.
the only thing i dilike i know its stupid and usless in the game but its how you mader only the draws open not the ovens and fridges and stuff
Went into settings, changed a thing and was then shown the start screen with no option to continue the current game? Refunded.

do i have all the achievements? yes, but do i regret getting them all? yes.

this game LOOKS interesting, but i can promise that its one of the biggest sleep inducing games ive ever had the misfortune of trying. is it only $3? yes, but i would HIGHLY recommend you save those measly three bucks because this game seriously is. not. worth. it.


EDIT:
after much debating, and having the devs ask, i replayed this game a little after when it received its update. unfortunately, i still dont find the game much better than before and still wouldnt recommend it. HOWEVER, i applaud the visual updates to the game and the effort to add more lore as well. i believe disabling headbobbing and motion blur should be an option in the settings as well as volume. i acknowledge the effort it takes to make a game, and this being the devs first, i hope The Cooking Class serves as a suitable teaching opportunity.

i would also like to note how i appreciate how vocal the dev team is with the people whove interacted with this project. i hope it serves them well.
the game is really fun
Omg that tune will stay with me forever haha YES I CAN COOOOOK TOO

Ok let's dive deep:

This game has the same assets of many other games? Yes. It does.
Does it feel like an asset flip? No. And here's why.
There are videos, audios, texturing which are obviously hand made.
Although not perfectly smooth it still is a nice game to play.
The morse code at the beginning, the phone number (try to send it a whatsapp message to see more horror and unlock a cool easter egg), everything adds to the lore and the horror.

Graphics: 7/10 - I'd give an 8 for the effort of the post processing and psx style, but again, the graphics are the same of every other indie horror game
Storyline: 10/10 - It has left me with the feeling that this is just the beginning of something much deeper
Gameplay: 7/10 - no cheap jumpscares, but the enemies are easily avoidable, a little improvement of the AI would be beneficial. Still though, very fun and scary.
Price: 10/10 - a bargain, I've bought it during sales but still worth the full price IMHO

I'd like to support the devs, hope they open up a Patreon or Kickstarter to fund what's next. I hate to be left with this cliffhanger. I want to know more about the Duponts.

Cheers fellas!

I won't eat for a while after this cooking class lol.
Devs must be nuts.

What's interesting about The Cooking Class is the fact that the devs took their time to change textures and stuff around the house so it doesn't have the same asset flip feeling other games of the same genre has. I also loved the 4th wall breaking part. Eerie if you ask me. 7.5/10 solid experience.
This game looked like the classic walking simulator for the first 5 mins then holy moly!! It got very dark very soon. Undiscovered jem.

Alright so:
Mixed but good feelings.
The game feels "off". It has that creepypasta/urban legend quality that unsettles me the most when playing something. The uncanny face of the chef during the cooking part, the details like the radio giving announcement of disappearances, everything is weirdly in place.
Pretty raw game. Worth the money.
Ps: that tune is now stuck in my head. I whistle it every other second.

Hats off to the devs

Cooking is just a pretext for the horror to come.
Dev owes me a new pair of underwear.

When I started off in that basement I thought I downloaded the wrong game lol...

All jokes aside, this game has the potential of being a classic. The cooking part is brief and honestly not super engaging but super useful to set the mood for what's next.

8/10 recommend
This horror game is truly remarkable. It combines elements that define a great horror experience, blending them with the art of cooking. I found it thoroughly enjoyable and 100% recommend it.  10/10

It gets creepy very fast very quickly. Don't expect to be cooking a lot. Plus the feature to skip the cooking class altogether and go into action mode from the beginning is a blessing if you want to replay faster.

Pros

- indie, fun game
- creepy af
- the backstory is really, really cool
- it leaves you with the feelings that more has to be discovered
- the atmosphere, man. Amazing
- the music gets stuck in your head for days (maybe that's a con lol)

Cons

- the animations are a little rough around the edges, there's room for improvement there, but for the price it is ok
- the TV trigger that activates automatically when you walk in front of it, maybe a prompt command would've been better
- it does give little to none hints, no markers, no help (this could also be a pro, if you like to hunt)

All and all it is a robust indie game. A little underrated if I may say so. You can tell this is a first release yes, but there's a lot of room for improvement for the devs.

I'll be waiting for The Cooking Class - First Course (cool name btw) DLC

Sounds sweet

I've played the game originally on Itch.io, to say I was disappointed would be an understatement. But man, the devs really did a job here.
Retextured the whole game, new mechanics, the creepy phone number easter egg, the secret code. Damn dude.
Two completely different games.
Kudos. Can't wait to play other games from you!

This is a chill little horror game that is actually pretty unique despite the recognizable assets.  Theres more than one obstacle which keeps the key hunting varied.  MAKE SURE TO GRAB THE FLASHLIGHT IN THE LIVING ROOM or youre going to have a bad time.

Developer seems passionate about fixes and even revisited the game and reworked a lot and added a neat PSX filter.

I quite enjoyed it and look forward to any future releases from the dev

Cheers!
Fun game to play around with especially for the price

This is not a game, it is an ARG. First and foremost, the "wear your headphones part already has four hints". The phone number on the paper (haven't figure that out yet), the album cover that spells "THEGROVEAWAITS", the birth certificate you can find later on in the game. Thomas Dupont and Thomas Winter might as well be the same person. Who is real I didn't understand. Also the morse code, I cannot understand what it says but it clearly is a morse code. Hats off to the developers for putting such immersive stuff into the game. WOW. Hyper reccomended.
This game is a really beautifully designed horror game that I really enjoy playing and I highly recommend it.
The game is a tremendous game in one word, I really recommend it.
Wow, what a game! It's a great game.
The game is simply amazing A truly legendary game
A truly legendary game
Damn, this game is great, baby
Damn, I don't want to eat anymore! It's still a great game

I love the game, I love how meticulously designed all the details in the game are.
If you like horror games, I highly recommend you to buy it.

I loved the game, it's a horror game that I really enjoyed, I highly recommend it.
If you like horror games, I highly recommend you to buy it.

I love the game, it's a really well designed horror story The story in the game is a really gripping story
If you like horror games, I highly recommend buying it.

Very nice Idea, well executed with a low budget. Very cool and typical movie-like horror atmosphere, nicely written story. If I may give an advice to the authors, give to the player a way to diminuish or remove the camera swing.

At the beginning of the game, we start by cooking at the beginning of the game, the game feels like a different game, and then the horror game story starts, a really well thought out game concept.
For those who love horror games, I definitely recommend you to try a game that can have a different experience.

All the details in the game are meticulously designed, the design of the house, the atmosphere of the game is very beautiful, I liked it very much.
If you like horror games, I definitely recommend you to buy it.
The game is very engaging, at first it feels like you are playing a cooking game and then it starts a beautifully designed horror story.

A nice and short horror game. A checkpoint would have been nice, but all in all it's fun.
So I would definitely recommend picking it up.

I really like the game, it has a really well designed horror story!
The character designs and the overall design of the game looks really good.
A good game for those who like horror games.

I loved the game, at first the game gives you a cooking lesson and then it turns into a really beautifully designed horror story!
All the details in the game are meticulously designed, whether it's the design of the house, or even the inside of the kitchen cabinets in the kitchen.
If you like horror games, I highly recommend you to buy it.

Nice short horror game. I would have added a checkpoint feature, but all in all it is gory and fun. The plot is simple, yet it leaves a lot of questions unanswered.
Suggested!

I mean its a horror game. the sound is pretty inconsistent, except when its a random loud noise to scare you. the enemies follow a set path that you can learn so its not too hard. just an unpolished game. with an annoying bug at the start that when you hit "play," it crashes.

was a little disappointed that it wasn't formatted for streaming. Caused stream to be severely laggy and ultimately crashed. I ran speed tests and check all of my system to be sure and all of my  equipment was working properly and at proper speeds. it wouldlve helped to have in game control hub to be able to reference how the controls work (if there is one, I never found it). Basically, they tell you that you are on your own and you have to figure it out for yourself. I think some people would prefer an option to have a tutorial of some kind.
reviews.developer_response:
Hi, we're currently working on a patch that should fix that issue of yours. For the mechanics of the game, we, maybe naively, thought it would have been much more fun to let the player feel the experience of being alone in a madhouse with very little hints. In hindsight, that may have backfired, that's why we're working on improving the game. 
If the next updates will make the game experience better for you, that's a big win for us.
We apologize and we're sorry for the inconvenience.

With love

Another Dev Company

reviews.review:
Cooked 1 dish 
Walked around the house
watched some movies
played hide and seek with a giant
very epic
https://youtu.be/oTDBbrpQR1U

I liked this game and I think it has potential, but there are a few details that would make the experience less stressful and enjoyable, also I did find a bug at the end that stops me from completing the game. See the feedback bellow, it was very close between a thumbs up/down but hopefully the developer will take some of these points into consideration and it would be definitely be a thumbs up. But for now, will be a no for me.

Good

- The atmosphere is great, the more you search the house the more sick and gruesome secrets you discover.
- I loved the cheesy VHS tapes videos, gave me darkweb vibes. 
- Game is not overly complicated objectives, really good for streaming and casual play. Not sure if the game has multiple endings, but it is the kind of game I would play again to find different endings.
- The plot in this game is very ‘Cheesy Horror’, and the developer did well to show that. As soon as she started talking about meat in the cooking class you knew exactly where the game was going, and if I was the character, I would have regretted my decision instantly of attending that class.

Bad

- various bugs, hopefully these can be fixed.
- you don’t have to open the doors to collect the items, you can literally pick up the items just by clicking on all doors/drawers which makes it a click fishing game.
- while at the cooking class makes the game doesn’t tell you that you have to walk away from the class 3 times before the games actually starts. 
- AI for the granny upstairs could be a bit better.
- music stays the same from the start menu  throughout the entire game.
- a option to pause/skip the dialogue would be great as sometimes it can go too fast.
- Biggest one for me is the bug at the end, where as soon as you go down the basement the antagonist appears and attacks you out of nowhere,  he gets stuck in an animation on your screen and you can’t do anything bud die and start over again. 

Recommendations 

- Please fix the bug at the end, I tried reinstalling the game and I still getting the same bug, if at least that bug is fixed, the game would become playable and I would definitely give the game a thumbs up.
- different music for the cooking part, not so spooky and then build up to a more ominous music once you start exploring the house.
- skippable/pause option for the dialogues for sure.
- some kind of indication that you have to leave the cooking class to start the actual game, I restarted the game 4 times before knowing I had to attempt to leave the cooking class 3 times to start exploring the house.
- more Jumpscares

I hope you find this feedback useful, this game has potential and perhaps could open up to other dark themed games from the same developer. I would love to get see a patch to fix these bugs and I would definitely have a another go at this game :).
reviews.developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback. It gave us a lot of food for thought.
We will do our best to take in consideration your suggestions, which we admit, have lots of good points in them. This is our first Steam released title and of course we have so much to learn, and every feedback is precious. 
We will try to implement some of all of the suggestions you've made to make the experience more enjoyable.

Ps: the three times out of the kitchen was purposefully left like that to test the player's curiosity to explore and be stubborn.
Like breaking a fourth wall kind of thing.

Thank you again for your feedback, we will work even harder.

The devs team

reviews.review:
Randomly saw this on my discovery queue (11k+ games queue'd), the aesthetic and cheap price brought me in.

I managed to escape on my third run through of it. Here is my game play and play through 
youtu.be/lzhEoxAZyTg
I will talk about the following; Gameplay/Horror/Achievements/Worth The Buy? below.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
Game is a standard cut from horror games, you got a flashlight, hide and move around enemies to not get caught. Not a game where you fight back. 
Your goal is to find a way out of the trapped house you're in. Notes are left around with lore and tips on how to avoid the enemies. There are 7 VHS tapes to collect which will reveal how to escape.

Controls are perfectly fine, sometimes I found picking up stuff I had to look at it from a different angle or spam like the button, other times I would grab it from a great distance, but this isn't hindering at all. 

Enemies are relatively easy to dodge but can surprise you if you get over confident. Learned that the hard way lol.
Interesting mechanics on the enemies to avoid them!

Game took about a 20 minutes on a full run through, took me about a hour to do a couple tries to find the secret stuff.

[h1] Horror [/h1]
This game uses cannibals as its main source of horror, but this game does even better is its ambience. Especially when youre doing the cooking class bit, Mrs Dupont mixed with the music really makes you feel like you're going to be stabbed in the back for grabbing some onions.

The actual jumpscares are kind of a let down. Them grabbing you for a second then just kinda carrying you is a little weird and lost its fear the second grab in.

The ambience makes you really feel like somethings coming to scare you pants off though. 

Outside of that the real horror is that if you do die, you have to start from the beginning again.

[h1] Achievements [/h1]

Its only got 7 achievements and they aren't hard. Get caught by the different enemies, fully complete the game and find a secret tape. I had trouble finding the secret tape, i searched every where I possibly could but couldn't find it. I will definitely be doing another run through of the game to find the tape as I don't want it to defeat me.

[h1] Worth the buy? [/h1]

If you're a fan of horror and want a quick good experience 100%. It's $3bucks and you can tell the devs put thought and heart into it. You'll have a good horror experience and it won't take too much of your time.

Easy achievement hunting? Also worth a pick up
Awesome

So far I am having fun playing the game, found out the hard way not to be a good student and stay in class......I think I got near the end while escaping my second go around but not 100% sure, one issue I have with the game is that you have to start alllllll the way over if you die, no save system or anyway to continue where you left off. So if you get really far and near the end and die........it's to the start you go, hopefully something gets implemented to fix that!!! Overall it is still a fun game that I would recommend!!!

https://youtu.be/5wGCDLRlKpc
reviews.developer_response: Thank you lots for your kind words! They mean the world to us! The dev team.
